comment: OMG, the Highline Trail is definitely a must visit location for everyone, nature at it's best.
The 9/11 Memorial and Museum is a sobering place to visit and a painful reminder of how far humans can go to get their point across.
The Yosemite Falls Trail took my breath away, the waterfall is a thing of true beauty.
What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas!!
After an enchanted family time at Walt Disney World, we took a trip to the Cocoa Beach and it wasn't a disappointment. The fun simply continued unabated.
Natural beauty at its very best, the Grinnell Glacier is a breathtaking place.
Besides being a great place to experience a little nature, Central Park has many attractions within its borders, and most of them are free, making it one of the few cheap things to do in NYC.
The Half Dome Hike was both a great challenging exercise and quite exhilarating.
The Strip has got it all when it's about entertainment. Hosting the next trip there with my friends.
Walt Disney World Resort knows how to host the ultimate family adventure, it was all blitz and glamor.
If you haven't been to Avalanche Lake, please make it a point to visit this endowed place of nature.
Went to see the Statue of Liberty, the movies do it little justice, it's truly imposing.
The Mist Trail to Vernal Fall and Nevada Fall is popular for a reason and I just found out why it is so, it's beauty is mystical.
The Fremont Street Experience was simply a magical fun place, we had so much fun.
My kids won't stop talking about Disney World, and keep asking when will be our next trip there, should I say more?
